law.catch_line: Sec. 2-961. Medal of Merit created; implementation of program
law.text: There is hereby created a "Medal of Merit" award which the Board of County Commissioners shall annually present to those citizens who have exhibited exemplary dedication to improve the quality of life in Miami-Dade County. The County Manager shall develop for approval by the Board an Administrative Order with appropriate procedures to implement a program for the award for the Medal of Merit.
law.EditorsNote: Ord. No. 99-50, § 1, adopted May 11, 1999, repealed sections 2-962—2-966 in their entirety. Former sections 2-962—2-966 pertained to the Medal of Merit Selection Committee and derived from Ord. No. 95-39, §§ 2—6, adopted Feb. 23, 1995.
law.footnote: FOOTNOTE(S): --- (90) --- Editor's note— Ord. No. 95-39, adopted Feb. 23, 1995, amended the Code by the addition of provisions which have been included herein at the discretion of the editor as Art. LXX, §§ 2-961—2-966. (Back)
